item.title: Troubleshooting Network Traffic with CRI-O and Kubernetes
item.description: Running immutable infra is the holy grail for many people, however there are times when you’ll need to get down in the weeds in order to troubleshoot issues. Let’s imagine a scenario; you need to verify that a pod is receiving traffic, but the image is built FROM scratch. As scratch containers are as minimal as possible, there’s no shell in the image, so there’s no way you can exec into it and hope to do anything remotely useful.
